sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: What is the scaling ratio used in the Barnsley fern algorithm if the stem is 1 unit long and the longest frond is 2.7 units long?
message_2:
The scaling ratio in the Barnsley fern algorithm can be determined by dividing the length of the longest frond by the length of the stem. In this case, the longest frond is 2.7 units long, and the stem is 1 unit long.

Scaling ratio = (Length of the longest frond) / (Length of the stem)
Scaling ratio = 2.7 / 1
Scaling ratio = 2.7

So, the scaling ratio used in the Barnsley fern algorithm for this scenario is 2.7.
